Expected Value: ISO-encoded date of OAI record ingest
Definition: the date of creation, modification or deletion of the record for the purpose of selective harvesting. Should be the most recent date.
Usage Notes: ISO date values currently in range of 2010 to 2016. Seems to be date of ingest into ILR.

Definition: A unique identifier unambiguously identifies an item within a repository; the unique identifier is used in OAI-PMH requests for extracting metadata from the item.
Usage Notes: Roughly, the cover-page (object in context) URL with the base URL slack replaced with ':'

Definition: the set membership of the item for the purpose of selective harvesting.
Usage Notes: The ILR Collections/Communities identifier. Portion after 'publication:' is used by the Collection Bepress URL.

Definition: A summary of the resource. Should be about content, not about the carrier/collection.
Usage Notes: Not heavily used. Contains HTML tags. Some are quite long - actually contain OCR or transcription?
Remediation Notes: Remove html tags. Make sure Abstracts containing line breaks and/or lists are including line breaks properly (they output as html blobs at present).

Expected Value: Literal (Numeric identifier that also appears at the end of the OAI Identifier and the Object in Context URL for Bepress.)
Definition: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.
Usage Notes: NOT UNIQUE. The same Article ID can be used across Collections/Sets. Only the OAI Identifier is unique.
Remediation Notes: We can't rely on this for accurate matching or enhancement.

Expected Value: Vcard/Author information as covered by following fields.
Definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work that is primarily textual in content, regardless of media type (e.g., printed text, spoken word, electronic text, tactile text) or genre (e.g., poems, novels, screenplays, blogs). Use also for persons, etc., creating a new work by paraphrasing, rewriting, or adapting works by another creator such that the modification has substantially changed the nature and content of the original or changed the medium of expression
Usage Notes: Not used at present explicitly in ILR - is captured by the following fields. Note: Author seems to be more generic 'Creator' field in Bepress, not specifically the 'Author'.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Email address for author.
Usage Notes: Mostly cornell.edu email addresses, though other institution email addresses are present too.
Remediation Notes: Can use for person matching in identification management systems (ORCID, ISNI, VIVO, etc).

Definition: The given name associated with the object. Should be a person, not an organization.
Usage Notes: Could also use CUL VIVO's HR ontology for 'preferredName' or 'firstName'.
Remediation Notes: Includes prefixes like 'Judge'. No other field to move these to, though. Otherwise, leave as found. Move organizational names to 'author/organization'.

Definition: Organization/Institution that the author works for or is affiliated with.
Usage Notes: Is the institution affiliated with the author, not an organizational author. Not normalized/controlled.
Remediation Notes: Some stray emails, personal names. Could do some entity resolution and complex name structure normalization (i.e. United States Department of Labor Bureau of International Labor Affairs versus United States Department of Labor, Bureau of International Labor Affairs.)

Definition: The family name associated with the object. Should be a person, not an organization.
Usage Notes: Some organization names mixed in. What to do with e.g. 'von Trapp' or similar?
Remediation Notes: Move organization names to organization. Normalize captialization. Some role terms included in parenthesis - e.g. (Editor) - no where to move these at present. Could normalize, however.

Definition: The middle name associated with the author. Shouild be a person, not an organization.
Usage Notes: Middle names, some middle initials.
Remediation Notes: Remove parentheses around some values? Otherwise, leave as is.

Definition: The name associated with the organization that is serving as author. Should be an organization, not a person.
Usage Notes: Wary of usage difference between Organization and Institution.
Remediation Notes: Could use some entity resolution, or at the least, normalization. Would want to review author's (person) institutional affiliation versus organization as author, though would require manual clean up.

Definition: The family name associated with the object. Should be a person, not an organization.
Usage Notes: Not sure if we're using this for 'honorific' suffixes. Sometimes it is actually the role term (i.e. Editor) instead of a suffix.
Remediation Notes: Normalize (removing trailing periods unless is abbreviation; remove trailing spaces after periods in abbreviations, Ph.D. versus PhD versus PhD., etc.). Move role terms elsewhere (parenthesis at end of lname or organization name)?

Definition: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.
Usage Notes: Not sure what this is derived from, but it is a document-specific, unique Bepress identifier. It is unique, but is also opaque.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: URL for the Bepress record with the object in context (i.e. the public-facing metadata record)
Usage Notes: Automatically generated, and closely related to the OAI identifier.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Discipline heading, ranges from departmental areas to fields to subject areas.
Usage Notes: Taken possibly from a controlled list? Looks to intersect somewhat with Cornell field area names.
Remediation Notes: Doesn't need normalization from what I can see. Could possibly be a candidate for entity matching/reconciliation, but uncertain of what it relates to vocab-wise.

Definition: Think this is closer to like mods:genre (A term or terms that designate a category characterizing a particular style, form, or content, such as artistic, musical, literary composition, etc.)
Usage Notes: Looks to be from a controlled list:    1 about24325 article   2 bg_info 332 bookreview   1 brief  15 chapter  22 comm_doc   3 foreword   5 front_matter   6 keydoc   2 memo   4 notice   1 opinion   9 paper  14 pr  12 report   1 rib   6 seminar_paper  43 statement   3 survey  22 testimony
Remediation Notes: review and normalize? (what is rib? Do we need underscores in these values?)

Definition: Acknowledge people or organizations who helped (including but not limited to funded) the author of the document.
Usage Notes: Free text. Mostly from ILR Reviews.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Not sure if this is a City as place of origin/publication, or city as in the work is about the city. I think it is probably the former.
Usage Notes: Either 'Ithaca, NY' or 'New York, NY'
Remediation Notes: Get LCNAF or other controlled vocabulary headings/URIs?

Definition: Is a mix of citations, comments about the work, rights statements, and URLs.
Usage Notes: In a variety of collections for a variety of purposes.
Remediation Notes: Can we get the Rights statements moved somewhere better? Many are copyright declarations. Uncertain of the role of the URLs included, but those could be moved as well.

Namespaced Schema Mapping: ? I'm sure there is a specific ontology somewhere for this.
Expected Value: Literal (in form of City, ST or ST)
Definition: The City and State, sometimes just State, of the Resource which is a Contract.
Usage Notes: Is this the jurisdiction (current) of the contract? I think so.
Remediation Notes: Get LCNAF or other controlled vocabulary headings/URIs?

Definition: If an OpenURL (?) has been created for this resource
Usage Notes: Seems to be for functional (to Bepress) purposes

Definition: Date (often a range) that the resource became or will become available.
Usage Notes: Perhaps not used as much anymore - only a handful of records have an embargo date, and only three of those are where the embargo date has not yet passed (unless those are blocked from the backup and/or OAI feed)
Remediation Notes: n/a

Namespaced Schema Mapping: Specific instance of Employer - rdau:P60679 would relate the Union or group covered in the contract/resource to the Employer. Otherwise, looking to describe as a signing part of the contract.
Definition: Employer involved in the Resource that is a Contract.
Usage Notes: Just used for BLSContracts 2. Mostly institutional names. I think this is the Employer involved in the contract that is the resource.
Remediation Notes: Get LCNAF or other controlled vocabulary headings/URIs?

Definition: Expiration date of the Resource that is a Contract.
Usage Notes: Date of the contract's expiration. Seems required for BLS contracts.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Namespaced Schema Mapping: n/a (should be inherent in value encoding of expiration date field)
Definition: Format of the expiration date.
Usage Notes: Not sure what purpose this serves, as all of the contract dates are ISO-encoded dates (e.g. 1988-01-01T00:00:00-08:00). So this field is always incorrect? Unless it guides display in some way.
Remediation Notes: Remove?

Definition: Some related place or institution? DCTerms definition: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant.
Usage Notes: Mixes in with 'City' field above. Seems to be what/where the resource is *about*, not where it originates from. But still unclear. Mostly city, state values, in no consistent manner. Some institution/corporate names involved.
Remediation Notes: Normalize and get LCNAF or other controlled vocabulary headings/URIs?

Definition: Some related institute.
Usage Notes: Just used in key_workplace and institutes collections. Values: 460 21stcentury  21 AFL-CIO  46 DOLSRS  10 DOLWB   8 EEOC  26 GAOreports  17 ICLP   4 JAR   9 NLRB   2 National_Commission_on_Retirement_Policy   4 TFEAD   1 TFESLG  51 cboreports   1 commissionfamily 132 commissionfuture 654 crsreports  11 federalmediation  20 foreignlabortrends  19 glassceiling
Remediation Notes: ? Not sure how what this field does so can't really comment on remediation.

Definition: Identifier for the contract?
Usage Notes: Only used in blscontracts2. Thinking this is the contract identifier.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Latitude for a spatial aspect of the resource.
Usage Notes: Only used in blscontracts2. Thinking it cannot be repeated otherwise you lose the ability to associate latitudes with longitudes (stored as separate field, below).
Remediation Notes: nothing that doesn't involve re-modeling questions.

Usage Notes: Only appears in ILR Review. Says 'ARRAY' in OAI-PMH XML, in s3 backup XML, and doesn't even appear on public-facing records (on the ILR bepress site nor the related SAGE site). So no idea what this is or if it is important.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Longitude for a spatial aspect of the resource.
Usage Notes: Only used in blscontracts2. Thinking it cannot be repeated otherwise you lose the ability to associate latitudes with longitudes (stored as separate field, below).
Remediation Notes: nothing that doesn't involve re-modeling questions.

Namespaced Schema Mapping: dct:format (as applied to the specific multimedia URL)
Definition: Multimedia application format for multimedia available at the multimedia URL.
Usage Notes: Only two values: 'embedly' or 'youtube'. Used a total of 45 times. Not sure what this is. Can only use once per record because there is no way to associate multimedia format with multimedia URL (stored in separate field).
Remediation Notes: nothing that doesn't involve re-modeling questions.

Definition: Multimedia URL.
Usage Notes: Most URLs are actually from kaltura and I'm guessing embedly is a Bepress plugin for those Kaltura files.
Remediation Notes: nothing that doesn't involve re-modeling questions.

Namespaced Schema Mapping: schema:naics (though it should really apply to the institution not the resource)
Definition: North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) number for the institution related to the resource.
Usage Notes: Can't use more than one per record for the sake of associated 1 NAICS field with 1 institution (employer?) field.
Remediation Notes: nothing that doesn't involve re-modeling questions.

Namespaced Schema Mapping: dbpedia-owl:numberOfEmployees (should be applied to the institution, not the resource)
Definition: Number of employees at the institution related to the resource.
Usage Notes: Can't use more than one per record for the sake of associated 1 number of works field with 1 institution (employer?) field.
Remediation Notes: nothing that doesn't involve re-modeling questions.

Namespaced Schema Mapping: dbpedia-owl:isPeerReviewed (range of this is the Journal, not the article)
Definition: Is the resource peer-reviewed?
Usage Notes: Used just for ILR Review and LRR
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Temporal duration of the related multimedia resource.
Usage Notes: Used for playback time of the related multimedia.
Remediation Notes: nothing that doesn't involve re-modeling questions.

Definition: Date of publication of the resource.
Usage Notes: Why is this used instead of publication-date (below)? It is used for all items. It is the same exact value for each field for all records where the field is used (publication-date, below, is used more often than this field).
Remediation Notes: Decide why this is used in tandem with publication-date and if this field should be removed?

Namespaced Schema Mapping: n/a (should be inherent in value encoding of publication date field)
Definition: Format of the publication date.
Usage Notes: Not sure what purpose this serves, as all of the publication dates are ISO-encoded dates (e.g. 1988-01-01T00:00:00-08:00). So this field is always incorrect? Unless it guides display in some way.
Remediation Notes: Remove?

Definition: An entity responsible for making the resource available.
Usage Notes: Currently contains just two values:    9 ILR Cornell Sports Business Society 104 International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union (ILGWU)
Remediation Notes: n/a

Expected Value: Literal (code or full value for state or local)
Definition: Sector covered by the contract?
Usage Notes: Currently used only in BLSContracts. Seems to be the governmental sector the resource (contract) applies to. Values used:    4 L   1 Local 639 Local government   7 Private   1 S 184 State government
Remediation Notes: Normalize the values used (L, Local => Local government, S => State government)

Namespaced Schema Mapping: dct:alternative (short title properties I've seen are usually for abbreviated titles, which these aren't)
Definition: Shorter version of the title of the resource.
Usage Notes: Used primarily in ILR Review or LRR.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: URL for another copy of the resource stored elsewhere - dropbox, a governmental site, etc.
Usage Notes: Used 3 times = twice in condex, once in perbfact.
Remediation Notes: Should we merge this into another field?

Definition: "Relates a resource to a serial or newspaper containing a single issue or a supplementary section devoted to a special subject, with or without serial numbering, such as an anniversary number of a periodical or newspaper."
Usage Notes: Used just for ILR Review.
Remediation Notes: Any reason to not make the existing field into a boolean? Or migrate to that RDA field instead?

Namespaced Schema Mapping: ?? Can we capture the relationship of the union and the resource?
Definition: Union covered by the resource in some way.
Usage Notes: Union names are merged right now in 1 field (name1; name2; etc.).
Remediation Notes: Normalize and get LCNAF or other controlled vocabulary headings/URIs; split multi-value fields.

Namespaced Schema Mapping: ?? Can we capture the relationship of the local union and the resource?
Definition: Union number or city affiliation.
Usage Notes: These are the chapters of the unions named above, represented by either a number or city state.
Remediation Notes: Should these be merged with the Union headings, above? Otherwise, no way to reliable relate union name in one field and union chapter number in the other field if there are multiple values. Modeling questions about Agents come in here too.

Usage Notes: Used with sportsinc and lgw_vol*. Uncertain what this field does.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: URL for the resource file (not the object in context/public record for the resource).
Usage Notes: Automatically generated, and points to the stamped.pdf file.
Remediation Notes: 207 records don't have this field at present. Can pull the identifiers for further review/analysis.

Definition: Keywords that describe the subject of the resource's content.
Usage Notes: The kind of keywords you find from self-deposited and autogenerated resource metadata. Most terms seem to be lower-case, but not all.
Remediation Notes: Create a dct:subject fields and normalized for better faceted searching (i.e. normalize with FAST)?

Definition: I believe this is the same as the Article ID (above).
Usage Notes: Uncertain what this is, to be honest. Is in every record. Something bepress auto-generates for record management within collections is my best guess.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: URL that links to downloading the original file submitted. Does not give the filename in the URL. Not present in all records.
Usage Notes: Not used for all records. Thinking this may be just for audiovisual materials, not PDFs.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Date the item was published. Appears to be entered in such a way that generates ISO-encoded date.
Usage Notes: Appears for all records. Uncertain if they are allow multiple dates of publication or not (alternatively, a new date of publication would become a new record/resource)
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: The name of the Bepress collection or set that the resource is a part of.
Usage Notes: Appears for all records. Perhaps automatically generated.
Remediation Notes: Uncertain if any cleanup or upkeep needs to happen here for the collection names.

Definition: Subject areas covering the content of the resource.
Usage Notes: Multiple subject areas put into one field. Only appears to have been used in 1 collection (workplace). Multiple values put into 1 field.
Remediation Notes: Split multi-value fields, normalize against some controlled vocab - either for classification purposes, or more general subject headings.

Definition: Date the item was submitted to Bepress.
Usage Notes: Autogenerated for all records.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Subdirectory in the Bepress application/backup files where the resource's metadata XML file, original file, supplemental files, and stamped.pdf live.
Usage Notes: Autogenerated for all records.
Remediation Notes: Use to find the exact location of the filenames for the original files to be saved and submitted to CULAR.

Definition: Filename for the supplemental file.
Usage Notes: Stored for supplemental files, but not for the original files.
Remediation Notes: Use these also to queue up files for include in CULAR.

Definition: Description or notes about the supplemental file.
Usage Notes: Sometimes includes the filename again.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: MIME Type for the supplemental file.
Usage Notes: MIME Type values mostly.
Remediation Notes: Clean up some stray values that aren't MIME Types showing up here.

Definition: Filename for the supplemental file as uploaded.
Usage Notes: Largely the same as the Filename/title, above.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: URL for the resource file (not the object in context/public record for the resource).
Usage Notes: Automatically generated, and points to the uploaded supplemental file.
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Title of the resource.
Usage Notes: Title of the resource. Does Bepress support more than 1 title?
Remediation Notes: Lots of the values have HTML, badly encoded characters in there. Can we clean this up?

Definition: Type/form of the resource.
Usage Notes: All have type 'Article'.
Remediation Notes: We have the Document-type field covering this; so can this field instead become the DCMI Type? I.e. Text, Audio, etc.

Definition: If the resource is withdrawn.
Usage Notes: n/a
Remediation Notes: n/a

Definition: Filename for the file originally submitted.
Usage Notes: Pulled from S3 backup directory structure.
Remediation Notes: Use for CULAR backups.
